evalue.name: Instruction address misaligned / User software interrupt
Instruction access fault / Supervisor software interrupt
Load address misaligned / User timer interrupt
Load access fault / Supervisor timer interrupt
Store/AMO access fault / Machine timer interrupt
Environment call from U-mode / User external interrupt
Environment call from S-mode / Supervisor external interrupt
Environment call from M-mode / Machine external interrupt
Both Debug mode and Machine mode can write the TDATA registers
Only Debug mode can write the TDATA registers
The trigger is an interrupt trigger
The trigger is an exception trigger
Trigger exists, but is not currently available.
A software breakpoint(ebreak instruction) was hit.(priority 3) This is also the reason for exception redirection to Debug Mode.
The Trigger Module caused a breakpoint exception.(priority 4)
The debugger requested entry to Debug Mode using haltreg.(priority 1)
The hart single stepped because step was set.(priority 0)
The hart halted directly out of reset due to resethaltreg. It is also acceptable to report 3 when this happens.(priority 2)
One DLMB exists and no double buffer mode support.
One DLMB exists and with double buffer mode support.
vector floating-point instructions are not supported.
Generate exceptions only on uncorrectable parity/ECC errors.
Generate exceptions on any type of parity/ECC errors.
Disable write-around HW mechanism. All cacheable write misses allocate a cache line according to PMA settings.
Override PMA setting and do not allocate a line after consecutive store to 4 cache lines.
Override PMA setting and do not allocate a line after consecutive store to 64 cache lines.
Override PMA setting and do not allocate a line after consecutive store to 128 cache lines.
Disable write-around HW mechanism. All cacheable write misses allocate a cache line according to PMA settings.
Override PMA setting and do not allocate a line after consecutive store to 16 cache lines.
Override PMA setting and do not allocate a line after consecutive store to 128 cache lines.
Override PMA setting and do not allocate a line after consecutive store to 512 cache lines.
The privilege mode is User mode
The privilege mode is Supervisor mode
The privilege mode is Machine mode
The privilege mode is User mode
The privilege mode is Supervisor mode
Instruction address misaligned / User software interrupt
Load address misaligned / User timer interrupt
Store/AMO access fault / Machine timer interrupt
Environment call from U-mode / User external interrupt
